events.name: Raider Assault
events.description: A band of raiders approaches your settlement, weapons drawn and hunger in their eyes. They demand tribute or threaten violence.

consequences.narrative_text: Your people take up arms to defend their home. Battle is inevitable.

choices.text: Pay them off to avoid bloodshed

consequences.narrative_text: The raiders take your supplies and leave, laughing. Your people feel shame, but they live.
Impressed by your strength, some raiders join your cause. Others leave, dissatisfied.

events.name: Disease Outbreak
events.description: A mysterious illness spreads through your settlement. Without proper treatment, many will die.

choices.text: Use medicine to treat the sick

consequences.narrative_text: Your medics work tirelessly. The outbreak is contained with minimal casualties.
You isolate the sick, letting nature take its course. Many die, but the outbreak doesn't spread.
Your scientists develop a treatment, saving lives and advancing medical knowledge.

events.name: Rich Scavenging Site
events.description: Scouts report an untouched warehouse full of pre-war supplies. It won't stay undiscovered for long.

consequences.narrative_text: Your people haul away valuable supplies before anyone else arrives.
Taking your time pays offâ€”you find hidden compartments full of treasures. But did someone hear you?
Your engineers fortify the site. You now have a permanent scavenging outpost.

events.name: Mysterious Wanderer
events.description: A lone traveler arrives at your gates, offering knowledge in exchange for shelter.

consequences.narrative_text: The wanderer shares stories and skills. Your people are enriched by their presence.
Under pressure, they reveal the location of hidden supplies. But trust is damaged.
You cannot risk unknown outsiders. The wanderer leaves, disappointed.

events.name: Leadership Challenge
events.description: A charismatic figure within your faction questions your leadership, gathering supporters.

consequences.narrative_text: Embracing democracy strengthens your faction. Two heads are better than one.
Your iron fist maintains order. Dissenters are imprisoned, loyalty is enforced.
The challenger leaves with a small group of followers, vowing revenge.

events.name: Merchant Caravan
events.description: A well-armed merchant caravan passes nearby, offering to trade rare goods.

consequences.narrative_text: A fair trade. Your vehicles and generators will run for weeks.
Medical supplies are priceless. Your people will be healthier.
You secure a lasting partnership. Regular caravans will visit your settlement.
You take their goods by force. But word will spread of your treachery.

events.name: Mutant Incursion
events.description: Radiation-twisted creatures emerge from the wasteland, attacking anything they encounter.

consequences.narrative_text: The mutants are fierce, but your defenders hold the line. Casualties are inevitable.
You abandon the settlement temporarily. The mutants ransack what remains.
Your scientists study the mutations. The knowledge gained could prove valuable.

events.name: Sealed Bunker Discovery
events.description: Your scouts find a locked pre-war bunker. The door mechanism still has power.

consequences.narrative_text: The explosion damages some contents, but you secure valuable supplies.
Your tech specialist bypasses the security. The bunker's contents are pristine.
You lack the means to open it now. The bunker will wait.

events.name: Nuclear Winter Storm
events.description: An unusually severe storm blankets the region in radioactive snow. Supplies run low.

consequences.narrative_text: Your people endure hunger, but survive the winter.
Warmth lifts spirits. Your people weather the storm in relative comfort.
Your engineers insulate the shelters. This protection will last for future winters.

events.name: Enemy Spy Discovered
events.description: You catch an infiltrator gathering intelligence on your faction. They claim to work for a rival.

consequences.narrative_text: The spy is executed publicly. Your enemies know you show no mercy.

choices.text: Turn them into a double agent

consequences.narrative_text: The spy agrees to feed false information to their masters. A valuable asset.
You negotiate a prisoner swap. One of your captured soldiers comes home.

events.name: Ancient Data Cache
events.description: You discover intact hard drives containing pre-war technical data. A treasure trove of knowledge.

consequences.narrative_text: You unlock advanced weapon designs. Your military power increases.
Pre-war medical procedures are recovered. Your healers become more effective.
Genetic crop data revolutionizes your food production.

events.name: Mass Refugee Arrival
events.description: Hundreds of refugees flee a destroyed settlement, begging for sanctuary.

consequences.narrative_text: Your compassion is rewarded. Many refugees join your workforce and military.
You take only those who can contribute immediately. The rest must find another home.
You cannot afford to feed them. The refugees leave, cursing your name.

events.name: Hidden Armory
events.description: Your scouts stumble upon a forgotten military weapons cache. But it's booby-trapped.

consequences.narrative_text: Your engineer's expertise pays off. You secure weapons and ammunition.
Explosions destroy much of the cache, but you salvage some supplies.
Discretion is the better part of valor. You mark the location for future consideration.

events.name: Harvest Festival
events.description: Your people organize a celebration of the harvest. It could boost morale, but costs resources.

consequences.narrative_text: Music, food, and joy fill your settlement. Morale soars.
A small celebration lifts spirits without breaking the bank.
Resources are too precious. Your people understand, but are disappointed.

events.name: Border Clash
events.description: Your scouts encounter another faction's forces in disputed territory. Tensions are high.

consequences.narrative_text: Your show of force intimidates the rival. The territory is yours, for now.
Diplomacy prevails. Both factions agree to respect the new border.
You retreat to prevent bloodshed. Your people question your resolve.

events.name: Solar Storm
events.description: Massive solar flares disrupt all electronics. Your systems go offline temporarily.

consequences.narrative_text: Your engineers work around the clock. Systems are restored quickly.

choices.text: Wait for the storm to pass

consequences.narrative_text: You endure the blackout. Eventually, systems come back online.
While systems recover, your scientists develop protection against future events.

events.name: Prisoner Escape
events.description: Captured enemy soldiers attempt to escape from your detention facility.

consequences.narrative_text: Your forces hunt down the escapees. Order is maintained.
You choose mercy. Perhaps they will remember your kindness.
You upgrade detention facilities. Future escapes will be much harder.

events.name: Library of Congress Ruins
events.description: You discover the ruins of a great library. Thousands of books survived in sealed chambers.

consequences.narrative_text: You establish a new library. Knowledge from the old world is preserved forever.
Engineering and medical texts prove immediately useful.
Survival trumps sentiment. The books keep your people warm through winter.

events.name: Mutant Rat Infestation
events.description: Giant mutated rats infest your food stores, consuming supplies and spreading disease.

consequences.narrative_text: Your people hunt the vermin. It's disgusting work, but necessary.
Poison eradicates the rats quickly, though some food is contaminated.
Desperate times call for desperate measures. Rat meat is... nutritious.

events.name: Radiation Aurora
events.description: Beautiful but deadly auroras dance across the sky. Radiation levels spike temporarily.

consequences.narrative_text: Protected from radiation, your people watch the haunting display through windows.
Your scientists gather valuable data, though some suffer mild radiation exposure.
Work continues, but many fall ill from radiation sickness. Productivity drops.

events.name: Bandit Negotiation
events.description: A notorious bandit chief requests a meeting under flag of truce. They claim to have valuable intelligence.

consequences.narrative_text: They reveal rival faction movements in exchange for safe passage. Useful intelligence.
You capture the bandits and their supplies. But word spreads of your treachery.
You turn away the messenger. The bandits disappear back into the wasteland.

events.name: Critical Equipment Failure
events.description: A crucial piece of machinery breaks down. Without repairs, production will halt.

consequences.narrative_text: Your engineers work miracles. The machine roars back to life.
It takes time, but you find working parts. Production resumes, delayed.
Creative engineering finds an alternative solution. Less efficient, but functional.

events.name: Talented Newcomer
events.description: A highly skilled individual arrives seeking sanctuary. They could greatly benefit your faction.

consequences.narrative_text: The newcomer shares valuable skills and knowledge. Your community is enriched.
After proving themselves, they join fully. Trust must be earned.
You gain their knowledge, but lose their loyalty. Fear maintains order.

events.name: Acid Rain Storm
events.description: Black clouds release toxic rain. Corrosive and deadly to exposed equipment and people.

consequences.narrative_text: Quick action prevents damage. Your infrastructure survives intact.
Dangerous research yields insights into environmental contamination.
Corrosion damages equipment and several people suffer chemical burns.

events.name: Hidden Underground Shelter
events.description: Children playing discover a hidden bunker entrance beneath rubble. What's inside?

consequences.narrative_text: The bunker yields preserved supplies and useful equipment.
Careful exploration reveals even more supplies, including fuel reserves.
You mark the location for future exploration when you have more resources.

events.name: Leadership Succession
events.description: Your second-in-command falls ill. Who will take their place in the chain of command?

consequences.narrative_text: Military discipline strengthens, but some fear growing militarism.
Civilian control is maintained. The people appreciate democratic principles.
Shared leadership distributes power. Decisions will take longer but be more balanced.

events.name: Illegal Goods Uncovered
events.description: Guards discover a hidden cache of prohibited items being smuggled into your settlement.

consequences.narrative_text: Public punishment deters future smuggling. Fear maintains order.
You take the contraband but spare the smugglers. A measured response.
Practical economics. Regulate what you cannot eliminate.

events.name: War Veteran Arrives
events.description: A grizzled military veteran from before the apocalypse seeks to join your faction.

consequences.narrative_text: The veteran trains your forces in old-world military tactics. Discipline improves.
Their strategic knowledge proves invaluable in planning operations.
Old soldiers carry old grudges. You accept them but watch carefully.

events.name: Cultural Divide
events.description: Two groups within your faction clash over fundamental values. The community fractures.

consequences.narrative_text: You impose a single cultural standard. Unity through suppression.
Different perspectives strengthen the whole. Tolerance becomes policy.
One group leaves to found their own settlement. Painful but peaceful.

events.name: Functional Factory Found
events.description: Scouts discover an intact pre-war factory. With power, it could produce valuable goods.

consequences.narrative_text: Assembly lines produce weapons. Your military power grows.
Manufacturing creates wealth. Trading partners are eager for your goods.
You dismantle the factory for parts. Immediate gain, lost opportunity.

events.name: The Prophet
events.description: A charismatic individual claiming divine visions gathers followers. They speak of destiny.

consequences.narrative_text: Faith provides hope in dark times. The prophet becomes a cultural leader.
Freedom of belief, within limits. The prophet preaches, you govern.
You exile the prophet. Their followers resent your interference.

events.name: Mutant Insect Plague
events.description: A swarm of mutated locusts descends on your crops, threatening the harvest.

consequences.narrative_text: Chemicals kill the swarm but contaminate some crops.
Flames drive them away. Scorched earth, but the harvest mostly survives.
Protein is protein. Your people eat what they must.

events.name: Scientific Discovery
events.description: Your researchers achieve a breakthrough in understanding pre-war technology.

consequences.narrative_text: Open science benefits all. Your generosity builds alliances.
Knowledge is power. Military applications are prioritized.
Technology improves daily life. Production and comfort increase.

events.name: Family Vendetta
events.description: An old blood feud between two families threatens to tear your settlement apart.

consequences.narrative_text: You enforce law impartially. Neither family is happy, but order is maintained.
You banish both sides. The settlement is more peaceful, if less populated.
Patient negotiation brings peace. Old wounds begin to heal.

events.name: Seismic Tremor
events.description: The ground shakes violently. Buildings crack and supplies scatter.

consequences.narrative_text: Quick repairs prevent further collapse. Structural integrity is restored.
You save the most important buildings. Others will have to wait.
Limited resources mean limited response. The settlement bears its scars.

events.name: Old World Recording
events.description: A functioning video player is found with recordings from before the apocalypse.

consequences.narrative_text: Seeing the old world brings both longing and determination to rebuild.
The recordings contain valuable technical and historical information.
The past is dead. You focus on the present and future.

events.name: Corruption Exposed
events.description: Someone exposes corruption among your administrators. Resources have been stolen.

consequences.narrative_text: Transparent justice is served. Trust in leadership is restored.
You recover stolen goods but rumors spread about what really happened.
You silence the whistleblower. But trust erodes beneath the surface.

events.name: Diplomatic Mission
events.description: A rival faction sends diplomats requesting formal relations and a non-aggression pact.

consequences.narrative_text: Peace dividends flow as trade and cooperation replace tension.
You drive a hard bargain. Peace, but on your terms.
You refuse to treat with them. Tensions remain high.

events.name: Prodigy Child
events.description: A remarkably intelligent child shows extraordinary aptitude for science and engineering.

consequences.narrative_text: You nurture brilliance. In time, they will change the world.
Hands-on learning accelerates their development.

choices.text: Let them have a normal childhood

consequences.narrative_text: Genius or not, they deserve to be a child. They'll contribute when ready.

events.name: Contaminated Water Supply
events.description: Your water source shows signs of contamination. People are falling ill.

consequences.narrative_text: Chemical treatment makes the water safe. Crisis averted.
Scouts locate a clean spring. You relocate water operations.
Fuel-intensive but effective. Illness rates drop.

events.name: Cultural Renaissance
events.description: Artists and musicians emerge, creating new works that capture post-apocalyptic life.

consequences.narrative_text: Culture flourishes under your support. A new golden age begins.
Art finds its own way. Creativity needs freedom, not funding.
Survival demands practicality. Art is a luxury you cannot afford.

events.name: Military Takeover Attempt
events.description: Ambitious officers attempt to seize power through military force.

consequences.narrative_text: Loyal forces defeat the conspirators. Authority is maintained through force.
Compromise avoids bloodshed. The military gains representation in government.
Your peaceful transition wins hearts. Leadership changes but stability remains.

events.name: Digital Archive Discovery
events.description: Intact servers containing pre-war internet archives are discovered. Petabytes of information.

consequences.narrative_text: Years of research lie ahead. But human knowledge has been recovered.
You focus on immediately useful information. Technical manuals and blueprints.
Knowledge is currency. Other factions pay handsomely for access.

events.name: Disease Pandemic
events.description: A virulent disease spreads across the region. Multiple settlements are affected.

consequences.narrative_text: Isolation protects you but strangles the economy. You survive, alone.
Your scientists create a vaccine. Thousands of lives are saved across factions.
Risky strategy. Survivors develop immunity, but losses are heavy.

events.name: Pre-War Time Capsule
events.description: Construction crews unearth a time capsule from 50 years before the apocalypse.

consequences.narrative_text: Messages from the past inspire hope. Technology and memorabilia spark joy.
You preserve history. Future generations will know the world before.
The past is irrelevant. You focus on the future.

events.name: Total Solar Eclipse
events.description: The moon blocks the sun completely. Darkness at midday sparks fear and wonder.

consequences.narrative_text: You study the celestial event. Knowledge dispels superstition.
You mark the moment with ritual. Shared experience strengthens community.
It's just an eclipse. Work continues.

events.name: Mass Desertion
events.description: Harsh conditions drive multiple people to desert, seeking better lives elsewhere.

consequences.narrative_text: Investment in quality of life pays off. Desertion stops, loyalty grows.
You make examples of deserters. Others stay through fear, not loyalty.
Freedom to leave means those who stay choose to be here. Quality over quantity.
